EUPHEMISMS.Definition: polite or softer words used to talk about something unpleasant

COINED.Definition: created (for a new word or phrase)

SPREAD.Definition: extended over a large or increasing area

LEXICOGRAPHERS.Definition: people who write or study dictionaries

BROADLY.Definition: in a general way; not too detailed

SHORTLIST.Definition: a small list of the final choices

INCLUSION.Definition: the act of adding or including it

PINPOINTS.Definition: shows the exact moment or thing

POLARISATION.Definition: when people split into two very different sides

UNAPOLOGETICALLY.Definition: without saying sorry or feeling bad

RESONATED WITH.Definition: felt right for; connected with their feelings

BURNT OUT.Definition: very tired and unable to keep going

SHRUGGED.Definition: lifted her shoulders to show she did not know

IN-JOKE.Definition: a joke only understood by a special group of people

TREND.Definition: something popular for a short time

MEME.Definition: a funny picture, video, or idea shared on the internet

GESTURE.Definition: a movement of the hand or body that shows meaning

CATCH-ALL.Definition: something used for many different things

ABSURDIST.Definition: very silly or strange on purpose

OLIGARCHY.Definition: a small group of powerful people controlling something

EXCESSIVELY.Definition: to a greater degree than is necessary or normal

UNDESERVEDLY.Definition: in a way that is not right or that someone does not deserve

SQUEEZED.Definition: pressured or feeling short of money

MULTITASK.Definition: try to do many things at the same time

PROMPTING.Definition: giving instructions or requests to an AI tool

SLIM.Definition: very small or thin; very unlikely

STAYING POWER.Definition: the ability to last for a long time

SNAPSHOTS.Definition: quick pictures or short examples of a moment

TIME CAPSULES.Definition: things that keep memories from a certain time

OBSCURITY.Definition: the state of being unknown or forgotten
